identified-content.org: Washington Institute for Near Eastern Policy

abstract.p: Correction of Oct 15 article on effect of resurgent Arab nationalism on Mideast peace effort, which misstated name and mission of Washington Institute for Near Eastern Policy; group holds it is public education foundation, not pro-Israeli group; article also misspelled name of institute fellow David Makovsky

block.p: An article on Sunday about the effect of resurgent Arab nationalism on the Middle East peace effort misstated the name and mission of a policy group whose director commented on the situation. It is the Washington Institute for Near Eastern Policy, not Near Eastern Affairs. It describes itself as a public educational foundation that supports scholarly research and debate on the Middle East, not a pro-Israeli group.
The article also misspelled the surname of an Israeli senior fellow at the institute whose concept of ''bottom-up peacemaking'' was cited. He is David Makovsky, not Markovsky.

It describes itself as a public educational foundation that supports scholarly research and debate on the Middle East, not a pro-Israeli group.
The article also misspelled the surname of an Israeli senior fellow at the institute whose concept of ''bottom-up peacemaking'' was cited. He is David Makovsky, not Markovsky.
